cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north then north-northeast, accelerate across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, strike Florida’s Big Bend, then sweep across Georgia and the Carolinas before moving offshore into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Apalachee Bay, FL)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend through Georgia and the coasts of South and North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind gusts (34–50 kt) possible Thursday, strongest early-mid-day as the center passes inland just west of the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential minor to moderate surge 2–4 ft in Charleston Harbor and adjacent coast as onshore flow peaks Thursday
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with localized totals exceeding 6 inches Wednesday night-Thursday, producing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands and short-fuse river flooding possible
